public java.util.List<LexicalItem> findAll()
Gets all LexicalItems from the database, fetching ClusterItems for each LexicalItem.

Specified by:

Returns:

findByLexId

public java.util.List<LexicalItem> findByLexId(int id)
Returns a list of LexicalItems having lexId id. lexId is not the unique id for a lexicalItem, different senses of the same lemma have the same lexId.

Parameters:
id - the lexId to search for
Returns:
a List of LexicalItem having id as lexId, an empty List if no element is found

findByLemma

public java.util.List<LexicalItem> findByLemma(java.lang.String lemma)
Find all items having param lemma as lemma.

Parameters:
lemma - the lemma to search for
Returns:
a List of LexicalItem having param lemma as lemma, an empty List if no element is found
Throws:
{@link - IllegalArgumentException} if lemma == null

Find all items having param lemma as lemma.

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:
{@link - IllegalArgumentException} if lemma == null

findItemsMatching

public java.util.List<LexicalItem> findItemsMatching(java.lang.String regex)
Finds all LexicalItems matching lemma. Note: the regex has to be made postgresql conform before calling this method - replace '(.)*' by '%' and '(.)?' by '_'. At the moment only simple wild card match is supported, no tests have been made for example with 'or' or character sets. Fetches ClusterItems for each found item.

Parameters:
regex - the regex to match
Returns:
a List of LexicalItems matching lemma, an empty List if nothing is found
Throws:
{@link - IllegalArgumentException} if regex is null

findMaxLexId

public int findMaxLexId()
Finds and returns the max value for lexId in table LexicalItem

Returns:
the max value for lexId in the table
